intro: Diplomorpha phymatoglossa, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. The flowers are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits.
